problem_prompt: Solve the following problem. A total of 180 marbles (gray, white, and black) are placed in a line. The first five are gray, followed by four white, followed by three black, followed by five gray, followed by four white, followed by three black,.... If this pattern continues, what is the color of the 158th marble in this line?
solution: We notice that the marbles appear in strings of 5 gray, 4 white, 3 black.  These strings have 12 marbles each.  Since  \[158=13\cdot12+2,\]there are 13 full strings of marbles and 2 extras.  Since the first 5 marbles in any group are gray, the two extra marbles must be $\boxed{\text{gray}}$.
gpt_response:
To find the color of the 158th marble in the line, we need to find out the pattern that will repeat after every 12 marbles.

Since the pattern repeats after 12 marbles, we can simplify the problem by finding the remainder when 158 is divided by 12.  

158 ÷ 12 = 13 with a remainder of 2.

This means that the 158th marble will be the same color as the 2nd marble in the pattern.

The pattern is: G-G-G-G-G-W-W-W-W-B-B-B-G-G-G-G-G-.....

Therefore, the 158th marble will be gray.
solution_prompt:

Since the pattern repeats after 12 marbles, we can simplify the problem by finding the remainder when 158 is divided by 12.  

158 ÷ 12 = 13 with a remainder of 2.

This means that the 158th marble will be the same color as the 2nd marble in the pattern.

The pattern is: G-G-G-G-G-W-W-W-W-B-B-B-G-G-G-G-G-.....

Therefore, the 158th marble will be gray.
